SEARCH
Package com.csse3200.game.ui

Class UIFactory

java.lang.Object
com.csse3200.game.ui.UIFactory
public class UIFactory extends Object
Factory class for creating UI components with consistent styling.

NOTE: This is not a static util class, it is instantiated as a static instance in UIComponent. This allows for the UI scale to be customized and the skin to be passed in to the constructor.

      Parameters:

    • primaryButton

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.TextButton primaryButton(String text, float width)
      Creates a primary button with consistent styling and UI scale support. Unfortunately, to make the buttons look crisp, we need to create the button style manually.

      NOTE: This does not work by itself for tables. You will need to call the getScaledDimensions() method above and set the table cell width and height.

      Parameters:
      text - the button text
      Returns:
      a styled TextButton

    • secondaryButton

      public com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.TextButton secondaryButton(String text, float width)
      Creates a secondary button with consistent styling and UI scale support.Unfortunately, to make the buttons look crisp, we need to create the button style manually.

      NOTE: This does not work by itself for tables. You will need to call the getScaledDimensions() method above and set the table cell width and height.

      Parameters:
      text - the button text
      Returns:
      a styled TextButton

      Create a standard "Back" or "Exit" button positioned in the top-left corner of the stage, using consistent styling and UI scaling.
      Parameters:
      eventHandler - the event handler to trigger when the button is clicked
      stageHeight - the height of the stage
      backOrExit - the relevant text for the button
      Returns:
      the configured and positioned ImageButton (not yet added to stage)
